member.name: T:ExcelDataReaderWrapper.My.Resources.Resources
member.summary: A strongly-typed resource class, for looking up localized strings, etc.

member.name: P:ExcelDataReaderWrapper.My.Resources.Resources.ResourceManager
member.summary: Returns the cached ResourceManager instance used by this class.

member.name: P:ExcelDataReaderWrapper.My.Resources.Resources.Culture
member.summary: Overrides the current thread's CurrentUICulture property for all resource lookups using this strongly typed resource class.

member.name: T:ExcelDataReaderWrapper.ExcelDB
member.summary: Use to access excel 97-2003 and xlsx. Problem realized with this is it reads inconsistent cells
member.remarks: if HDR is false and first rows contains field names. if IMEX is false first row will be ignored, it will be set as column names. if IMEX is true first row will be added and all will be string. ColumnNames will be F1,F2 ...

member.name: P:ExcelDataReaderWrapper.ExcelDB.FilePath
member.summary: The path to the excel file

member.name: P:ExcelDataReaderWrapper.ExcelDB.IMEX
member.summary: IMEX=TRUE indicates read all columns as string. Note: this might affect writing back to the excel file but ok for readonly

member.name: P:ExcelDataReaderWrapper.ExcelDB.HDR
member.summary: HDR=YES, indicates first row contains field names

member.name: M:ExcelDataReaderWrapper.ExcelDB.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Use to access excel 97-2003. HDR=TRUE, IMEX=TRUE

member.name: M:ExcelDataReaderWrapper.ExcelDB.#ctor(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.param: HDR=YES, indicates first row contains field names
DEPRECATED! NOT USED! :=> IMEX=TRUE indicates read all columns as string. Note: this might affect writing back to the excel file but ok for readonly

member.name: M:ExcelDataReaderWrapper.ExcelDB.GetFirstSheet
member.returns: DataTable or Nothing if not found
